description.@value: It&rsquo;s fall, but the weather is still nice. A table has been set outside. The turkey is roasting in the oven. Everything is all set for a family dinner&mdash;except that the playwright wants to rework his play. He wants to comment on it and rewrite it in real time, as a group of actress siblings, their author brother and a critic engage in a verbal sparring match.&nbsp;

description.@value: Spectacle et remise de prix&nbsp; Le&nbsp;Gala Trille&nbsp;Or est de retour pour honorer et r&eacute;compenser les artistes de la sc&egrave;ne musicale francophone de l&rsquo;Ontario et des provinces de l&rsquo;Ouest. Au cours de cette soir&eacute;e tant attendue, plusieurs artistes se produiront sur sc&egrave;ne, dont C&eacute;leste&nbsp;L&eacute;vis, M&eacute;lissa Ouimet,&nbsp;JOLY, Shawn Jobin et Matt&nbsp;Stern. La soir&eacute;e sera ponctu&eacute;e par la remise des prix Trille Or, prestigieuses distinctions du milieu de la chanson franco-canadienne. Tapis rouge &Agrave; partir de 18&nbsp;h, les artistes en nomination fouleront le tapis rouge sous le regard de la foule. Profitez de l&rsquo;occasion pour encourager ces artistes qui colorent le paysage musical francophone au Canada et ailleurs.&nbsp; &Agrave; propos de Trille Or Organis&eacute; tous les deux&nbsp;ans, le Gala Trille&nbsp;Or rassemble le monde de l&rsquo;industrie musicale francophone et le grand public. Cette 12e&nbsp;&eacute;dition marque le retour de l&rsquo;&eacute;v&eacute;nement en personne, le dernier gala s&rsquo;&eacute;tant d&eacute;roul&eacute; sans public. But, to paraphrase Leonard&#8239;Cohen, maybe that&rsquo;s how the light gets in.&nbsp;

In 2013, Nova Scotian choral conductor Scott Jones was left paralyzed after a homophobic attack. Soon after, he chose to publicly forgive his attacker. The story of I Forgive You cuts straight to the heart of mercy and is accompanied by a children&rsquo;s choir singing the music of&nbsp; Sigur Ros, conducted by Scott himself in this braiding of rich theatrical invention and searing unavoidable truth.&nbsp;

description.@value: Featuring: Kate Wyatt - piano/compositions Lex French - trumpet Adrian Vedady - bass Jim Doxas - drums Originally from Victoria BC, pianist and composer Kate Wyatt is now considered one of the top tier jazz musicians in the city of Montreal. She has been praised as having &ldquo;musical ideas and a style of playing and writing that is on par with the current jazz piano elite: Mehldau, Yaron Herman, Shai Maestro, Fred Hersch,&rdquo; and has been hailed as &ldquo;one of the top artists of Montreal, Quebec, or even Canadian jazz.&rdquo; (Cardin/Brunet, panm360.com) In July 2022 Wyatt released her debut album Artifact to excellent critical reviews. Joined by Lex French (trumpet), Adrian Vedady (bass) and Jim Doxas (drums), she leads a quartet whose effortless chemistry fosters deep interaction and high intensity. As one reviewer described, &ldquo;Artifact is filled with melody, spirit, and a joy for playing together that brings the listener hope. This album is a gem. Highly recommended!!&rdquo; (Richard Kamins, Step Tempest) Kate Wyatt has performed with many recognized and respected musicians, including Kenny Wheeler, Jay Clayton, Ira Coleman, Yannick Rieu, Christine Jensen, Itamar Borochov, Ranee Lee, Don Thompson, Barry Elmes, Al McLean, and the Orchestre national de jazz de Montr&eacute;al (ONJ). She has a passion for improvisation and innovation, and strives for a high level of sensitivity and interaction in her performances. Her music has been recognized with awards from the Canada Council for the Arts, FACTOR, and the Conseil des arts et des lettres du Qu&eacute;bec. As well as being a passionate performer and composer, Wyatt is a deeply invested music educator. She conducts masterclasses and heads the jazz program at Marianopolis College. Kate has been working as part of the Canadian Amateur Musicians/Musiciens Amateurs du Canada (CAMMAC) teaching team for over 10 years.

description.@value: Inspired by the writer&#39;s own life experience, this intimate journey of a mother seeking to understand her daughter&#39;s autism delves into the polychromatic shades of experience for families with neurodiverse children in Quebec. In navigating the many obstacles thrown in her path by our healthcare and education systems, Rose&#39;s mother goes through the greatest of barriers to arrive at the richest of realizations and ultimately, hope for the future.

In 2007, a video of inmates dancing in a Filipino prison to Michael Jackson&rsquo;s Thriller quickly became one of the internet&rsquo;s first viral videos. Now it has inspired this exciting new musical by Filipino-Canadian creators Romeo Candido and Carmen De Jesus. Prison Dancer is a brave musical about redemption and how a prisoner named Lola brings purpose and joy to a group of inmates ready to feel the rhythm together.&nbsp;
